perturbation.original_text:
Within 30 days of the end of each quarter during the term of this agreement, PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT shall receive from THE HENRY FILM
AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, a detailed accounting statement showing Net Due and Paid Shared Revenues for that quarter and shall
remit to PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT its share of such revenues.
perturbation.changed_text:
Within 60 days of the end of each quarter during the term of this agreement, PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT shall receive from THE HENRY FILM
AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, a preliminary accounting statement showing Net Due and Paid Shared Revenues for that quarter. The final statement with the exact amounts shall be delivered within 90 days after the end of each quarter, and THE HENRY FILM
AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION shall remit to PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT its share of such revenues.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states payments should be made within 30 days of the quarter's end. The modified text extends this to 60 days for a preliminary statement and 90 days for final remittance, creating an inconsistency in payment deadlines. It's unclear when the payments should be made.

perturbation.original_text:
SHARED REVENUE: In lieu of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT granting a 10 year Exclusive Content License to THE HENRY FILM AND
ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, THE HENRY FILM ANDENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION agrees to share 10% of the net revenue from any
and all advertising sales, Syndication Fees and Licensing fees generated from all television shows, DVD Magazines, Internet Streaming Video
Television Shows, Television Shorts, Radio Shows, Radio Shorts, Cell Phone Video Clips, Caller ID Video Clips, Promotional Commercials, Websites,
Streaming Video Commercials, Streaming Video Highlight Shows, 24 Hour Nostalgia Sports Network, DVD Program Package, Television Show
Series, stock footage library, and print promotional posters, created and or produced with any content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT.
perturbation.changed_text:
SHARED REVENUE: In lieu of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT granting a 10 year Exclusive Content License to THE HENRY FILM AND
ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, THE HENRY FILM ANDENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION agrees to share 10% of the gross revenue from any
and all advertising sales generated from all television shows created and or produced with any content provided by PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by modifying the revenue sharing agreement. Originally, the agreement specifies 10% of net revenue from a wide range of sources. The modified text changes this to 10% of gross revenue but only from advertising sales for television shows. This directly contradicts the original definition of revenue and the sources from which it is derived, leading to uncertainty about the actual revenue sharing terms.

perturbation.original_text:
INITIAL TERM AND RENEWALS: This Agreement will become effective as of the last date of signature (Effective Date) and shall, unless sooner
terminated as provided below or as otherwise agreed, remain effective for an initial term of 10 Years following the first date of public availability of
the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content within a THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION Property (the “Initial
Term”). After the Initial Term, this Agreement will be automatically renewed for successive additional 3~year periods (“Extension Terms”), unless
otherwise terminated by either party by giving notice to the other party not less than sixty (60) days prior to the end of a Term. As used herein, the
“Term” means the Initial Term and any Extension Term(s).
perturbation.changed_text:
INITIAL TERM AND RENEWALS: This Agreement will become effective as of the last date of signature (Effective Date) and shall, unless sooner
terminated as provided below or as otherwise agreed, remain effective for an initial term of 5 Years following the first date of public availability of
the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content within a THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION Property (the “Initial
Term”). After the Initial Term, this Agreement will be automatically renewed for successive additional 1~year periods (“Extension Terms”), unless
otherwise terminated by either party by giving notice to the other party not less than thirty (30) days prior to the end of a Term. As used herein, the
“Term” means the Initial Term and any Extension Term(s).
perturbation.explanation: The modification creates an in-text contradiction by changing the initial term from 10 years to 5 years, the extension terms from 3 years to 1 year, and the notice period for termination from 60 days to 30 days. This introduces ambiguity and uncertainty about the actual duration of the agreement and the conditions under which it can be terminated.
